title.narrative: 4.3 : PREPAREDNESS AND RESPONSE TO CRISIS AND SHOCKS

description.narrative: Communities, households and national and subnational institutions are better prepared to respond to crises and shocks, including those caused by climate change, and to maintain service delivery for affected women and children through systems strengthening., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation (Covid), Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid), Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Operations Support To Programme Delivery (Covid), Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions (Covid), Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Innovation, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Risk-Informed Humanitarian And Development Nexus Programming, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys live in more-inclusive and resilient communities strengthened by an enabling environment and systems that createequitable chances in life.

related-activity.ref: 2760/A0/05/004 PILIER 4 : ENABLING ENVIRONMENT FOR INCLUSIVE COMMUNITY RESILIENCE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Communities, households and national and subnational institutions are better prepared to respond to crises and shocks, includingthose caused by climate change, and to maintain service delivery for affected women and children through systems strengthening.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued efforts to strengthen the national system for emergency preparedness and response as well as the implementation of interventions that contribute to the resilience of communities and systems. These efforts have been extended to the effective coordination of the humanitarian response both at the national and regional levels, as well as in supporting the authorities to roll out shock-sensitive local development planning, particularly with regard to the PDSEC.; With contingency stocks pre-positioned in the most at-risk regions, UNICEF directlyassisted 45,549 people (including 20,519 women and 19,218 children) affected by various crises. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:05/01/2022
